ygData.subject: Re: BlackFortress
ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson nodds to Kup who he respects greatly as a comrade. You re right, we need to leave.  But there s something I need to do.  Cyclonus, if I were you I d be

Tucson nodds to Kup who he respects greatly as a comrade.

"You're right, w=
e need to leave.  But there's something I need to do.  Cyclonus, if I were =
you I'd be worried about your fellow Decepticons, Scourge and Scoroponok.  =
Get them out of here as fast as you can. Hydras is using you as puppets, he=
 doesn't have a shread of compassion for any of you.  Go on, be the Decepti=
con you wish to be.  It's a right that even I can't take away from you." 

=
He then turns to Hydras.

"I'm sorry I can't save you Hydras.  You've slipp=
ed through the cracks and there isn't anything I can do for you, except def=
end those who truely deserve to be protected."

He aims his missile launche=
rs at Hydras.

" I believe you know what these are capable of. It's your ch=
oice Hydras, what will it be?"

..> wrote:
>
> 
> Kup/Darkhawk/Perceptor/hydras:
> 
> "No!!!!!"Yelled an an=
gry Darkhawk before fell in stasis, Kup managed to drag him away of the Pre=
dacons.
> 
> "We need to move out!!!"yelled Kup
> 
> Hydras Was very mad th=
is time "DONT LET THEM RUN AWAY!!!!! PRIME WITH MY BARE HADNS I'LL RIP THE =
MATRIX and YOUR SPARK OUT YOUR BODY!!!" 
> 
> Perceptor continued Shooting =
agaisnt the MAximals
> 
> 
> 
> From: Sandy 
> Sent: Monday, April 12, 2010=
 10:31 PM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> Subject: Re: BlackFortress
> 
> 
=
>   
> OOC: Tucson collapsed due to extreme exhaustion and some moderate bu=
rn damages from the magma. Yes, even magma didn't stopp him from trying to =
help his comrades. He's got some burn marks in his armor, and that's his da=
maged state for now.
> 
> BIC: 
> 
> Perhaps the power he had extended outw=
ard, was in vain. Tucson lies on the ground for a moment or so, but slowly =
rolls back up onto his left side, holding up his upper body with his arms w=
hich shake under the sheer pressure of his weight. He looks around, and fin=
ds Darkhawk, severely weakened by the powerful blast. Night Shift wastes no=
 time in slapping a pair of stasis cuffs on Darkhawk, who in reality was Wi=
ndlord.
> 
> "Gotchya. Don't worry, you're in good hands now. Yo, Kup! Bett=
er take this guy for me, I think Tucson Prime's commn' around."
> 
> Tucson=
 calmly looks around yet with a stern expression on his face.
> 
> "Not - t=
he result I was hoping for but - it did enable us to get somewhere. Can't -=
 have it all I suppose, but doesn't mean we're giving up all together."
> 
=
> Slowly he makes it onto his knees, and then plants one foot down on the g=
round, hoisting himself up to his feet, with a bit of a stumble. He was wea=
k, extremely weak, and it was questionable wether or not he would be able t=
o continue fighting. He didn't want anyone to see him in such a condition t=
hough. He fights his weakness and tries to shrug off the grogginess he feel=
s. Night Shift nodds in agreement with Tucson Prime. 
> 
> " I hear ya on t=
hat one big bot. Sometimes, ya win some, ya lose some, and sometimes it's k=
inda like in the middle of both losn' and winn'n."
> 
> Tucson understood t=
hat the mission itself would be difficult so he prepared himself for the un=
expected by working with that uncertainty that plans don't always go as the=
y are intended. He shrugs off the fact that Cyclonus is not even scathed by=
 the energy attack. He was now curious about Rodimus and how he had handled=
 it. 
> 
> " Something - Rodimus wasn't too good at doing. I have a feeling=
 he may not have taken this too well, Nightshift."
> 
> Nightshift narrows =
his optics.
> 
> " Lemme tell ya somethn' Tucson, before you became a Prime=
, and he was on the job, it didn't look like his spark was totally in his w=
ork. But you, the quiet guy in the corner, the guy who threw caution ta the=
 wind ta save his comrades, the guy who faces adversity as it comes and ain=
't afraid of it, and the guy who actually learned from his loss rather than=
 complain'n about it. You got what it takes, and always had it. It - just w=
asn't obvious because you're too modest for your own good and you kinda jus=
t kept ta yourself most of the time."
> 
> Tucson listens thoughtfully to N=
ightshift.
> 
> " You're right, I wasn't much for words at the time... But =
back then, I wanted to approach Rodimus on his not so pleasurable attitude =
on his position as a Prime. It seemed as if he didn't want it. And you know=
, responsibility isn't for everyone. And for some, it's second nature."
> 
=
> Night Shift nodds.
> 
> " Understandable. Now I admit, I dunno if I could=
 ever take your job big guy. Not that I ain't capable of it, I know I ain't=
 a good match for the position. And I ain't afraid ta admit that."
> 
> Tuc=
son Prime nodds once, and studies Cyclonus once more. Something dawns on hi=
m. He seemed relieved to be free of something. 
> 
> "Is it me Cyclonus or =
do you appear to be liberated of something that may have been holding you b=
ack? Why do you work with Hydras anyway? What is the purpose of working wit=
h him when you can be your own individual? Your life should be as you inten=
ded, and not what others have intended for you. It boils down to freedom. Y=
ou have the chance to experience freedom. If I were you I'd take that chanc=
e now. As a matter of fact, Scorponok, Scourge, what seems to be holding yo=
u two back here, when you yourselves can be your own individuals as Decepti=
cons? Does Hydras have you on some sort of leash? I see no such restraints =
so that means if you want freedom you should also take it."
> 
> Night Shif=
t could see what Tucson was up to. It was one of his thinking outside the b=
ox kind of strategies. And a strategy that would benefit all and not just o=
ne faction. Tucson was trying to break new ground, and as crazy as it all l=
ooked, he sits back to watch it all take place. Tucson Prime now steps assi=
de and waits to see if any of them either try to destroy him, or actually a=
gree with what he was trying to tell them.
> 
> "Whatever any of you chose,=
 your decision is your own and I will not interfere. We may not be allies, =
but I do respect the need for one's free will. But if you attack me, do not=
 expect me to be so forgiving."
>

r and looked around for a moment. He nodded, satisfied

no intruders in the hall. He looked back at Nightlight

 her to follow.

ular mode and opened his door.

 engine. "I will will protect you.

oom. If there is anywhere that is

ere."

e took
